name: Understanding Digital Change Through Postcolonial Politics
description:
How are people’s online and offline lives connected? How do people navigate the space between the digital and the analogue, especially in the context of oppression? 

Join Claire Crawford in a public lecture as she examines these questions from her forthcoming book, ‘Tethered’. The book combines ethnographic engagement with social movements and postcolonial ideas to understand why history and place matter. In the book she introduces ‘tethering’ as a simple way to recognise how digital change depends on context. The project addresses a ‘blind spot’ where many theories about digital change ignore differences between people and individual choice.

name: Exhibition Opening: Women in Mathematics Around the World
description:
Join us for the opening of the exhibition ‘Women in Mathematics Around the World’. The exhibition brings together photographic narratives of women mathematicians from around the world and explores the lives, work, and intellectual journeys that shape the production of mathematics across different contexts. 

The exhibition is presented in collaboration with the Consulate General of the Federal Republic of Germany in Bengaluru, the International Centre for Theoretical Sciences (ICTS), and the Raman Research Institute (RRI).

Following opening remarks there will be a guided walkthrough of the exhibition.

name: A Bite of CALORIE: Walkthrough
description: Join the Experimentor team for a closer look at our new exhibition season, CALORIE, one bite at a time. This walkthrough, invites you to reflect on the ideas of food, nutrition, and energy. As we move through the exhibition, the Experimentors Beverly and Noyonika will unpack the intimate, and often complicated, relationships we share with food, nourishment, and the systems that sustain us.

name: Making Data Bi(y)te-Sized: How to Cook Data For Better Understanding
description:
How can we present data in a way that is not alienating or boring?

Join Padmini Ray Murray, Aman Bhargava, and Debanshu Bhaumik for a hands-on workshop that explores creative approaches to data visualisation. Drawing on datasets from the ongoing exhibition-season CALORIE, participants will experiment with transforming data into compelling visual recipes that are meaningful.

The workshop emphasises play, storytelling, and design thinking and concludes with participants showcasing their visualisation outcomes.
